intro: Romulea campanuloides, commonly known as the bell-shaped romulea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and blooms in late summer to early autumn. Its flowers are typically borne on tall, slender stems and are adapted for pollination by insects. Romulea campanuloides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its unique appearance and hardiness.
